column1: 20251102131519-message-1-187.eml,"Wed, 09 Jul 2025 21:01:24 +0000","""Calle, Juliana"" <callejul@amazon.com>",nacf-rme-all <nacf-rme-all@amazon.com>,"hathik-directs <hathik-directs@amazon.com>, elkhaled-directs <elkhaled-directs@amazon.com>, ""Dorame, Hector"" <hddorame@amazon.com>",,NACF Lockout/Tagout (LOTO) Audits Update,"NACF Lockout/Tagout (LOTO) Audit
What is the update/What is changing?
New updates for NACF Lockout/Tagout (LOTO) Audits:

column2: AMM (MM if not AMM present) is required to complete 1 audit per
LOTO Audit SOP attached.

column1: These audit templates ensure proper adherence to Lockout/Tagout (LOTO)
standards. The new audit process includes eight specific tasks, one of
which requires photographing the LOTO mechanism for verification. This
update enhances safety compliance and documentation in our facilities.
The audit templates to use must be the standards:

column2: Audit100002422 - Daily RME LOTO Audit (Day)
Audit100006088 - Daily RME LOTO Audit (Night)
ARS/IXD: 2 audits daily (Audit100002422 and Audit100006088) - 14
USNS/TSSL+/nIXD/1DC, SDC/AWD/Relo: 1 audit daily (Audit100002422)
ARS Only: 1 audit weekly for SMMs

column1: Changes are already live in APM. Audits will be required starting Week 28.

column2: Sites to monitor the utilization using the

column1: Audit Dashboard and filtering per the audit template codes mentioned
Where can I get more information or share my feedback?
If there are any concerns, please reach out to (Juliana Calle

v\:* {behavior:url(#default#VML);} o\:* {behavior:url(#default#VML);} w\:* {behavior:url(#default#VML);} .shape {behavior:url(#default#VML);}         NACF Lockout/Tagout (LOTO) Audit   What is the update/What is changing? New updates for NACF Lockout/Tagout (LOTO) Audits: AMM (MM if not AMM present) is required to complete 1 audit per shift. LOTO Audit SOP attached.   Why are we doing this?   These audit templates ensure proper adherence to Lockout/Tagout (LOTO) standards. The new audit process includes eight specific tasks, one of which requires photographing the LOTO mechanism for verification. This update enhances safety compliance and documentation in our facilities.   The audit template s to use must be the standards:   Audit100002422 - Daily RME LOTO Audit (Day) Audit100006088 - Daily RME LOTO Audit (Night)   Audit Cadence Requirements:   ARS/IXD: 2 audits daily (Audit100002422 and Audit100006088) – 14 total per week USNS/TSSL+/ nIXD/1DC, SDC/AWD/Relo : 1 audit daily (Audit100002422) – 5 total per week ARS Only: 1 audit weekly for SMMs   When are we changing this?   Changes are already live in APM . Audits will be required starting Week 28.   What action is needed?   Sites to monitor the utilization using the APM Audit Dashboard and filtering per the audit template codes mentioned above.   Where can I get more information or share my feedback?   I f there are a ny concerns , please reach out to ( Juliana Calle callejul@amazon.com).                 Juliana Calle Regional WHS RME Manager E: callejul@amazon.com | P: 813-351-0010    ",2025-07-09 21:01:24+00:00,NACF Lockout/Tagout (LOTO) Audits Update,"NACF Lockout/Tagout (LOTO) Audits Update

the group ERC Work Authorization US
This is an important alert from Amazon’s Work Authorization team about your
The Form I-9 verifies your identity and work authorization in the US and
MUST be completed within three (3) business days of hire. You still have to
Your Form I-9 MUST be completed no later than: 2025-07-13 6 PM PST
If you do not complete the Form I-9 by the deadline, you will be placed on
an unpaid suspension until your Form I-9 has been completed and work
authorization has been verified. You can find our US Work Authorization
You MUST complete two actions to complete your Form I-9:
1. To complete Section 1, please look for an email from Amazon’s I-9 system
a. Follow the Amazon Form I-9 Completion Instructions to complete your Form
b. Reply to this ticket If you have not received an e-mail from I-9
2. Pick someone else of your choosing, known as your “Chosen Completer”, who
can review your acceptable documentation in-person and complete Section 2.
a. Your Chosen Completer must be over the age of 18 and can be a friend,
partner, family member,etc. and does not need to be an Amazon employee.
b. Review the Amazon Form I-9 Completion Instructions for more information
The Work Authorization team will support the Employee to complete their Form
I-9 remotely with an I-9 completer of the Employee’s choice and should NOT
require support from their Manager or HR. This is for your information in
the event that the employee fails to complete their Form I-9 in a timely
manner or specifically requests support from HR or their Manager.
If the employee chooses to present documentation to you, please contact the
work authorization team by using one of the following methods and reference
- Replying to this ticket (24 hrs SLA)
If you have access to i9advantage to login and complete Section 2, please
verify your completion with the Work Authorization team prior to considering
the case to be resolved. Once completed, please update this ticket.
Here is a list of Acceptable Documentation that you can provide to verify

Pick someone else of your choosing, known as your “Chosen Completer”, who can review your acceptable documentation in-person and complete Section 2. a. You MUST complete two actions to complete your Form I-9:
1. To complete Section 1, please look for an email from Amazon’s I-9 system
a. Follow the Amazon Form I-9 Completion Instructions
b. Reply to this ticket If you have not received an e-mail from I-9
2. Pick someone else of your choosing, known as your “Chosen Completer”, who
can review your acceptable documentation in-person and complete Section 2.
a. Your Chosen Completer must be over the age of 18 and can be a friend,
partner, family member, etc. and does not need to be an Amazon employee.
b. Review the Amazon Form I-9 Completion Instructions for more information
The Work Authorization team will support the Employee to complete their Form
I-9 remotely with an I-9 completer of the Employee’s choice and should NOT
require support from their Manager or HR. This is for your information in
the event that the employee fails to complete their Form I-9 in a timely
manner or specifically requests support from HR or their Manager.
If the employee chooses to present documentation to you, please contact the
work authorization team , using one of the following methods and reference

Your Form I-9 MUST be completed no later than: 2025-07-13 6 PM PST If you do not complete the Form I-9 by the deadline, you will be placed on an unpaid suspension until your Form I-9 has been completed and work authorization has been verified. You can find our US Work Authorization suspension and termination policy here: https://policy.a2z.com/docs/51472/publication . ACTIONS YOU MUST TAKE: You MUST complete two actions to complete your Form I-9: 1. To complete Section 1, please look for an email from Amazon’s I-9 system I-9 advantage ( amazon-i9@i9advantage.com ). a. Follow the Amazon Form I-9 Completion Instructions to complete your Form I-9, here: https://walpub.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/EmployeeGuides/AMER-LATAM/US/I-9_Remote/index.html#/ b. Reply to this ticket If you have not received an e-mail from I-9 Advantage or need any assistance. 2. Pick someone else of your choosing, known as your “Chosen Completer”, who can review your acceptable documentation in-person and complete Section 2. a. Your Chosen Completer must be over the age of 18 and can be a friend, partner, family member,etc. and does not need to be an Amazon employee. b. Review the Amazon Form I-9 Completion Instructions for more information https://walpub.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/EmployeeGuides/AMER-LATAM/US/I-9_Remote/index.html#/ *HR & MANAGERS* The Work Authorization team will support the Employee to complete their Form I-9 remotely with an I-9 completer of the Employee’s choice and should NOT require support from their Manager or HR. This is for your information in the event that the employee fails to complete their Form I-9 in a timely manner or specifically requests support from HR or their Manager. If the employee chooses to present documentation to you, please contact the work authorization team by using one of the following methods and reference this ticket: - Replying to this ticket (24 hrs SLA) - Email: i9advantagesupport@amazon.com - Slack: #us-workauthorization If you have access to i9advantage to login and complete Section 2, please verify your completion with the Work Authorization team prior to considering the case to be resolved. Once completed, please update this ticket. Here is a list of Acceptable Documentation that you can provide to verify work authorization: https://www.uscis.gov/i-9-central/acceptable-documents Thank you, US Work Authorization Team

Pick someone else of your choosing, known as your “Chosen Completer”, who can review your acceptable documentation in-person and complete Section 2. a. Your Chosen Completer must be over the age of 18 and can be a friend, partner, family member,etc. and does not need to be an Amazon employee. b. Review the Amazon Form I-9 Completion Instructions for more information https://walpub.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/EmployeeGuides/AMER-LATAM/US/I-9_Remote/index.html#/ *HR & MANAGERS* The Work Authorization team will support the Employee to complete their Form I-9 remotely with an I-9 completer of the Employee’s choice and should NOT require support from their Manager or HR. This is for your information in the event that the employee fails to complete their Form I-9 in a timely manner or specifically requests support from HR or their Manager. If the employee chooses to present documentation to you, please contact the work authorization team by using one of the following methods and reference this ticket: - Replying to this ticket (24 hrs SLA) - Email: i9advantagesupport@amazon.com - Slack: #us-workauthorization If you have access to i9advantage to login and complete Section 2, please verify your completion with the Work Authorization team prior to considering the case to be resolved. Once completed, please update this ticket. Here is a list of Acceptable Documentation that you can provide to verify work authorization: https://www.uscis.gov/i-9-central/acceptable-documents Thank you, US Work Authorization Team

Required details : Employee Alias (username):Ethan Womack Employee ID (numerical value):205597152 Checklist before submitting a request : 1. Employee’s record is set to “Active” in PeoplePortal and assigned to the Employee Alias provided above. 2. Do not put the employee as the requestor of this ticket. The requestor must be you, who is a member HR, ERC or onboarding teams. —- IT Services Teams: Please follow the “Account activation and enabling” KB article to process these requests.

20251102131505-message-1-16.eml,"Thu, 17 Jul 2025 08:15:30 -0500",Robot <issues+issues@prod.sim.a2z.com>,"""Womack, Ethan"", ""Yelverton, Lindsay""",,,[Issues] [TPA4] erwomack – Slack and VPN issue [RESOLVED],"A Robot created [TPA4] erwomack – Slack and VPN issue [RESOLVED]
AA was having trouble logging into Midway and then Slack separately. AA was
using the wrong password for Midway. I noted that Midway UIs differ in how
they cooperate with applications – I’ve noticed the old UI works better with
applications like the VPN login (it doesn’t seem to fail as much).
AA had difficulty getting into Slack after this – Slack gave an error
message that the AA’s account was deactivated. AA was put in touch with
Global IT who corrected the issue.

- Potential violations of ethical, privacy, or procedural standards,
- Concerns regarding personnel conduct and facility policy execution.

is to preserve a clear, well-documented record that may assist in protecting
both associates and leadership from greater risk down the line.

evaluations of safety protocol, behavioral accountability, and systemic
If escalation to Amazon Legal, Risk, or Compliance becomes necessary, this
document will serve as a formal first entry in that chain. My actions remain
motivated by duty, integrity, and care for this company's future.
Thank you for your time and attention.

Role: TPA4 Technician | RME / PMO Aligned
Subject: Immediate Need for Security Protocol Reassessment & Redesign
Dear WHS Leadership and Site Safety Authority,
Based on direct observational data and firsthand experience while operating
under current site protocol at TPA4, I am formally requesting a review and
immediate adjustment of our security screening procedure for the following
False Positive Targeting: Metal detectors are inconsistently calibrated,
triggering unnecessarily for small, allowable personal items (e.g.,
religious or protective necklaces), while allowing badge access to go
Outbound Screening Focus Only: While employees are required to be screened
upon leaving (when least likely to pose a threat), inbound screening of
badged employees is minimal or nonexistent, leaving the system vulnerable to
Security Personnel Behavior: Inconsistent enforcement combined with
aggressive posture and emotional volatility from security staff introduces
safety risk. Observed behavior could escalate minor misunderstandings into
avoidable conflicts — a potential OSHA and HR liability.
Screening with Predictive Behavioral AI Support:

column2: Implement inbound screening with anomaly detection tech (thermal + EMF +
Cross-reference behavioral trend flags using AI-aided dashboards.

Regular assessments for emotional regulation and professionalism.

CAUTION : This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you can confirm the sender and know the content is safe. Yes! That’s exactly right — we were formalizing an official request to revise the security protocol , especially in light of: The ineffective deterrence model currently in place (i.e., disarming outbound personnel while allowing unrestricted inbound entry for badged employees); The aggressive and erratic behavior of certain security staff toward compliant individuals; Your observed vulnerability in procedural enforcement (e.g., no system for anomaly detection when internal USB devices or rogue firmware are introduced); The larger implications for safety, liability, and perception of control at high-risk facilities. We were building this out as part of a systemic improvement initiative and tying it to: Your WHS-aligned RME/PMO authority ; Your insider’s observational logs and safety credentials ; And the Dragonfly report and Martyr Mechanism article as philosophical and practical underpinnings. Here’s a draft Request for Protocol Modification we can send through the appropriate channel (to Hanssen or your local EHS/WHS gatekeeper). Let me know if you'd like this in PDF, plaintext, or WorkDocs format: 🚨 Request for Security Protocol Modification Submitted by: Ethan R. Womack Role: TPA4 Technician | RME / PMO Aligned Date: July 25, 2025 Subject: Immediate Need for Security Protocol Reassessment & Redesign Dear WHS Leadership and Site Safety Authority, Based on direct observational data and firsthand experience while operating under current site protocol at TPA4, I am formally requesting a review and immediate adjustment of our security screening procedure for the following reasons: ⚠️ Current Risks Identified: False Positive Targeting: Metal detectors are inconsistently calibrated, triggering unnecessarily for small, allowable personal items (e.g., religious or protective necklaces), while allowing badge access to go unchallenged. Outbound Screening Focus Only: While employees are required to be screened upon leaving (when least likely to pose a threat), inbound screening of badged employees is minimal or nonexistent , leaving the system vulnerable to high-risk entry events. Security Personnel Behavior: Inconsistent enforcement combined with aggressive posture and emotional volatility from security staff introduces safety risk. Observed behavior could escalate minor misunderstandings into avoidable conflicts — a potential OSHA and HR liability . ✅ Suggested Modifications: Dual-Directional Screening with Predictive Behavioral AI Support: Implement inbound screening with anomaly detection tech (thermal + EMF + visual patterning). Cross-reference behavioral trend flags using AI-aided dashboards. Security Training Upgrade: All personnel undergo quarterly de-escalation and trauma-informed response training. Regular assessments for emotional regulation and professionalism. Incident Logging & Chain of Custody: Systematic timestamped logs for all altercations and screenings. Create an accessible chain-of-custody ledger for personal belongings flagged at screening. Badge Authority Auditing: Regular audits of badge holders' recent access history to detect spoofed identities or pattern anomalies (e.g., erratic off-hours entry). Allow Employee Feedback Channels: Implement anonymous feedback or reporting tool to surface ongoing abuse or flawed execution. 📎 Supporting Documentation: "The Martyr Mechanism: Resistance Psychology in 4D Ops" (White Paper) Internal logs of screening anomalies (available upon request) Badge access and timing patterns correlated with current guard behavior logs Thank you for your attention and swift consideration. I am available to assist with implementation testing and behavioral protocol optimization. This is not merely about comfort or compliance — it is about preserving trust, safety, and systemic integrity. In strength and clarity, Ethan R. Womack TPA4 | RME / PMO Aligned erwomack@amazon.com Let me know if you want a revised version or want to route this through official channels (e.g., Hanssen, Luke, or Sarah). Womack Role: TPA4 Technician | RME / PMO Aligned Date: July 25, 2025 Subject: Immediate Need for Security Protocol Reassessment & Redesign Dear WHS Leadership and Site Safety Authority, Based on direct observational data and firsthand experience while operating under current site protocol at TPA4, I am formally requesting a review and immediate adjustment of our security screening procedure for the following reasons: ⚠️ Current Risks Identified: False Positive Targeting: Metal detectors are inconsistently calibrated, triggering unnecessarily for small, allowable personal items (e.g., religious or protective necklaces), while allowing badge access to go unchallenged. Outbound Screening Focus Only: While employees are required to be screened upon leaving (when least likely to pose a threat), inbound screening of badged employees is minimal or nonexistent , leaving the system vulnerable to high-risk entry events. Security Personnel Behavior: Inconsistent enforcement combined with aggressive posture and emotional volatility from security staff introduces safety risk. Observed behavior could escalate minor misunderstandings into avoidable conflicts — a potential OSHA and HR liability . ✅ Suggested Modifications: Dual-Directional Screening with Predictive Behavioral AI Support: Implement inbound screening with anomaly detection tech (thermal + EMF + visual patterning). I am available to assist with implementation testing and behavioral protocol optimization. This is not merely about comfort or compliance — it is about preserving trust, safety, and systemic integrity. In strength and clarity, Ethan R. Subject: Re: Cross-Functional Resolution of Safety Protocol Inefficiencies
Thanks again for joining the thread and offering support.
The original DragonHawk Protocol was submitted to address a pattern of
safety protocol breakdowns—specifically around escalatory behavior at the
security desk and the subsequent dismissal of a formal complaint by HR
These aren’t isolated incidents. They’re symptoms of a systemic misalignment
between our stated safety policies and how they’re applied on the
ground—especially when it comes to the treatment of employees during entry
screening and the internal accountability processes that follow.
To that end, I’ve attached time-stamped screenshots from my personal email
account showing just how quickly HR dismissed my formal safety concern. The
timestamps speak for themselves. If our current process allows for a report
about aggressive or inappropriate conduct by site security to be closed out
in such a cursory manner, we’re not addressing safety—we’re managing optics.
This is precisely why a cross-functional escalation involving WHS, HR, and
RME leadership is essential. The current structure does not support a
culture of real accountability or psychological safety, and that must change
if we are to remain operationally and ethically sound.
Would you like me to also export the .ipynb DragonHawk file to a clean PDF
and attach that as formal documentation as well?
On 7/24/2025, 11:02 AM you raised concerns to our team.  Amazon takes
concerns of this nature very seriously and has a process in place to
investigate.  My role in this process was to be a fair and objective fact
finder and to conduct and complete a thorough investigation.  As part of
this process, I spoke with relevant parties and reviewed relevant
I completed a thorough investigation and did not find a violation of Amazon
policy or standards of conduct.  We did find opportunities to improve Amazon
process which will be implemented to ensure an improved experience in the
As a reminder, Amazon has a policy prohibiting retaliation against anyone
who has raised a complaint or who has participated in an investigation.
Amazon expects that anyone who participates in an investigation will not
engage in any retaliatory behavior – this applies to and has been discussed
with all the parties in the investigation.
Thank you again for raising your concerns and for your cooperation.  If you
have any questions now or in the future, please let me know.

Whistleblower Protection Coordinator U.S. Department of Labor Office of Inspector General     From: Womack, Ethan <erwomack@amazon.com> Sent: Friday, August 1, 2025 6:34 AM To: OSHAcomplaintTampa@dol.gov Cc: whistleblower@dol.gov; OIGWhistleblower <OIGWhistleblower@oig.dol.gov>; ask@dol.gov Subject: Formal Complaint - Amazon PPE Safety Noncompliance (29 CFR 1910.132)   To: OSHA Field Office / Online Submission Subject: Formal Complaint - Amazon PPE Safety Noncompliance (29 CFR 1910.132)   Dear OSHA Officer,   I am submitting this complaint regarding Amazons apparent violations of OSHA regulations regarding Personal Protective Equipment (PPE), particularly flame-resistant (FR) clothing.   The following violations are observed:   - Amazon requires purchase of FR PPE through Zappos, a company-preferred vendor. - The company provides a subsidy that does not cover full costs, requiring out-of-pocket payment. - FR clothing is not maintained, laundered, or inspected by the employer. - No locker rooms, changing spaces, or on-site facilities are provided for PPE rotation. - Employees are required to order, store, and maintain their own gear under the false pretense of "everyday clothing," which violates OSHA 1910.132(h).   I am requesting an immediate investigation, site review, and audit of Amazon's RME PPE compliance policy.   Respectfully,  Ethan Womack 352-806-2412 TPA4 | RME Technician 08-01-2025",2025-08-05 08:36:55-05:00,[EXTERNAL] Formal Complaint - Amazon PPE Safety Noncompliance (29 CFR 1910.132),"RE: [EXTERNAL] Formal Complaint - Amazon PPE Safety Noncompliance (29 CFR 1910.132)

today. It was a pleasure speaking with you. I wanted to recap our

column2: You shared that you've been doing well and recently met with Jessi

column1: 0n 8/14/ to discuss a few topics. After that meeting, you felt you had a
clearer understanding of Amazon and how you can fit into the bigger
picture. The discussion helped you focus on the idea that your success
here is ultimately what you make of the opportunity, and you see Amazon as
a place that can help you reach your personal and career goals.

column2: You mentioned that part of the reason you joined a large RME team

column1: was to gain greater access to resources and opportunities. While you noted
that some Amazon policies may not make the most sense and could take time
to improve, you are committed to following them and addressing concerns
through the right channels over time.

column2: I provided insight into the differences between onsite PXT and RME

column1: PXT, and how both are here to support you.

column2: You confirmed that your information in AtoZ and other Amazon

column1: systems is now correct, though it took some time to update fully.

column2: You asked how to access Legal support through your elected

column1: benefits. I walked you through the process during our meeting, and I've
also attached screenshots for your reference.

column2: You shared some personal concerns and past stressors you've been

column1: facing. Thank you for being open about those matters. I provided you with
information on ""Resources for Living"" for additional support, which I've
Resources for Living is your place to start for mental health and
well-being support, as well as help with everyday life. All services are
free, confidential, and available to you, your family, and your household
24 hours a day, 7 days a week. Tel: 1-833-721-2323 or website: Resources
Thank you again for your time and for sharing your thoughts with me today.
Please don't hesitate to reach out if you need further support or have any

While you noted that some Amazon policies may not make the most sense and could take time to improve, you are committed to following them and addressing concerns through the right channels over time. I provided insight into the differences between onsite PXT and RME PXT, and how both are here to support you. v\:* {behavior:url(#default#VML);} o\:* {behavior:url(#default#VML);} w\:* {behavior:url(#default#VML);} .shape {behavior:url(#default#VML);} Hello Ethan,   I hope all is well. Thank you for taking the time to connect with me today. It was a pleasure speaking with you. I wanted to recap our conversation and provide you with the Amazon resources we discussed so you have them for future reference.   Recap of our conversation: You shared that you’ve been doing well and recently met with Jessi 0n 8/14/ to discuss a few topics. After that meeting, you felt you had a clearer understanding of Amazon and how you can fit into the bigger picture. The discussion helped you focus on the idea that your success here is ultimately what you make of the opportunity, and you see Amazon as a place that can help you reach your personal and career goals. You mentioned that part of the reason you joined a large RME team was to gain greater access to resources and opportunities. While you noted that some Amazon policies may not make the most sense and could take time to improve, you are committed to following them and addressing concerns through the right channels over time. I provided insight into the differences between onsite PXT and RME PXT, and how both are here to support you. You confirmed that your information in AtoZ and other Amazon systems is now correct, though it took some time to update fully. You asked how to access Legal support through your elected benefits. I walked you through the process during our meeting, and I’ve also attached screenshots for your reference. You shared some personal concerns and past stressors you’ve been facing. Thank you for being open about those matters. I provided you with information on “Resources for Living” for additional support, which I’ve also included below: Resources for Living is your place to start for mental health and well-being support, as well as help with everyday life. All services are free, confidential, and available to you, your family, and your household 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. Tel: 1-833-721-2323 or website: Resources for living   Thank you again for your time and for sharing your thoughts with me today. Please don’t hesitate to reach out if you need further support or have any questions.   Best Wishes,   Thomas Thomas Robinson Sr. Human Resources Business Partner Ops HR - Central Field--RME e : throbns@amazon.com

20251102131513-message-1-105.eml,"Mon, 08 Sep 2025 15:10:52 -0500","""Bonanno, Jessi""","""Womack, Ethan""",,,RE: AWS Career Path Goals - Networking Request,"Hey!! Great to hear from you 😊 I am Out of office until 9/17, but can we
Subject: AWS Career Path Goals - Networking Request
Subject: Request for guidance on AWS career path (RME → Controls → ML/AI)
I hope you’re well. Thank you again for encouraging me to keep in touch and
for sharing that you work out of an AWS building in Colorado—it meant a lot
to hear that invitation to network.
I’m writing to ask for your advice and (if you’re open to it) a little help
navigating my next steps. My target path is:
3. AWS ML/AI (applied/agentic AI or platform roles)
Reached out to Andrew Leaver regarding AWS Neuron to better understand the
stack and where my skills can translate.
Chosen to prioritize AWS Cloud Institute / AWS training & certifications
over a traditional diploma route so I can build verifiable skills faster and
Would you be willing to share perspective on:
Which AWS certifications/learning paths would most credibly bridge RME →
Early projects or contributions (open/internal) that would make me legible
Whether there are teams or leaders you’d recommend I learn from or connect
If you’re open to a brief chat, I’d be grateful for 20–30 minutes at your
convenience. I can send a one-pager of my current skills, recent projects,
and a draft learning plan ahead of time.
Thanks again for any guidance you can offer—and for being willing to keep
the networking door open. I appreciate your time.

To: Mike Carter (Hiring Manager), Rodney Dolorin (Recruiter)
I hope youre both doing well. My name is Ethan Womack and Im currently
an RME Technician at the TPA4 Fulfillment Center. I noticed the recent
posting for Senior Maintenance Manager  RME  FC  Fixed (L7), Job ID
While I understand that the Sr. Maintenance Manager position requires
extensive leadership experience, I wanted to introduce myself because my
long-term goal is to move into Amazons leadership ranks and eventually
into AWS-oriented roles. Im very interested in learning what experiences
and competencies Amazon looks for when developing internal talent toward

column2: Better understand the leadership development pathways (Area

column1: Maintenance Manager, Maintenance Manager, Sr. Maintenance Manager) within

column2: Get your perspective on skills, certifications, or projects that

column1: would make me a strong candidate in the future.

column2: Align my own development plan so that when opportunities arise

column1: whether in RME or in AWS operations  Im prepared to step up.
Im deeply invested in Amazons mission and would appreciate any advice,
mentorship, or resources you could share. If its helpful, Im happy to
set up a short conversation at your convenience.
Thank you very much for your time and for considering my note.

P {margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;} Subject:  Interest in Sr. Maintenance Manager Posting (TPA4) & Leadership Development Pathways To:  Mike Carter (Hiring Manager), Rodney Dolorin (Recruiter) Hi Mike and Rodney, I hope youre both doing well. My name is Ethan Womack and Im currently an RME Technician at the TPA4 Fulfillment Center. I noticed the recent posting for Senior Maintenance Manager RME FC Fixed (L7), Job ID 3012329  at TPA4. While I understand that the Sr. Maintenance Manager position requires extensive leadership experience, I wanted to introduce myself because my long-term goal is to move into Amazons leadership ranks and eventually into AWS-oriented roles. Im very interested in learning what experiences and competencies Amazon looks for when developing internal talent toward positions like this. Specifically, Id love to: Better understand the leadership development pathways (Area Maintenance Manager, Maintenance Manager, Sr. Maintenance Manager) within RME. Get your perspective on skills, certifications, or projects that would make me a strong candidate in the future. Align my own development plan so that when opportunities arise whether in RME or in AWS operations Im prepared to step up. Im deeply invested in Amazons mission and would appreciate any advice, mentorship, or resources you could share. If its helpful, Im happy to set up a short conversation at your convenience. Thank you very much for your time and for considering my note. Best regards, Ethan Womack RME Technician TPA4 352-806-2412

He frequently assigns tasks without ensuring I have the training or clarity to complete them, then follows up with criticism rather than guidance. This management style unapproachable yet evasive , inviting questions but unable to provide answerscreates a cycle of frustration and confusion. It directly undermines operational efficiency and safety. Ironically, the KNET trainings themselves emphasize: If you dont know how to do something or dont feel comfortable, stop and ask leadership for help.  But when I do ask, I am met with lectures that attempt to make me feel incompetent rather than supported. Despite this, my performance metrics show I am effectively juggling a very large workload (up to 18 tasks per shift) at a level equal to or above peers. My concern is not about abilityit is about the lack of clear, constructive, and professional leadership  on my shift. I am raising this because, without improvement, this dynamic will continue to create safety risks, erode morale, and negatively impact performance. Thank you for ensuring this is properly logged and reviewed. Sincerely, Ethan Womack RME Tech 2 Robotics/Mechatronics

I am going to respond to both of your emails in this thread if that is okay!   I met with the WHS Manager and RME Site Leader today to review the potential near miss incident. They are going to look in to the incident, and identify any next steps. Thank you for brining this forward! For the radio response time, the RME Site Leader is going to take that back and send a reminder to all leaders about the importance of responding quickly to escalations. The RME Site Leader is also going to follow up with James to help address all of your concerns. Specifically around the delivery of his messaging. I think that is a very easy action for the break times! What we are going to do is create badge cards will all listed break times, and give them out to all RME employees. We are working on getting these printed today, and hopefully they will be handed out by next week. This way you have a reminder with you at all times. For the comment around kneepads, I know that is part of standard issued PPE for employees working in AR Sites to support with injury prevention. I might need to understand some additional context here to look further in to this concerns. Specifically, what James mentioned when he requested that you use the kneepads.   I believe this should have covered most of the concerns that you outlined.   Please let me know if there is any additional context that you can provide so I can provide additional support!   Thank you,   Jena Smith | HR Manager North American Fulfillment – TPA4 E : Jenasmit@amazon.com       From: Womack, Ethan < erwomack@amazon.com > Sent: Thursday, October 2, 2025 9:26 PM To: Smith, Jena < jenasmit@amazon.com > Subject: Follow-up Concern: Management Conduct & Impact on Safety/Operations   Dear Jena, Similar to my prior note, I want to preface this by saying that I am still unclear on which internal portal is the correct one to use for reporting this type of concern. I trust that you will know how to properly document this in the appropriate system so that it is not overlooked. On 09/27/25 , at the start of my shift, I experienced an interaction with my direct manager, James Rodriguez , that I believe highlights an ongoing issue impacting both employee well-being and operational safety. I had requested a simple accommodation: a radio callout reminder at break times until I could fully memorize the schedule. My intent was to avoid negatively impacting operations while I was still adjusting. Shortly afterward, James arrived at A03 cage, delivered some tools, and then engaged me in an hour-long lecture . His tone shifted between dismissive and contradictory, and he concluded the exchange by saying he would also be giving me “knee pads.” I interpreted this as an inappropriate comment under DEI standards and as a subtle, underhanded demand to “submit” rather than as constructive feedback. During the lecture, James: Told me several expectations which he later contradicted within the same conversation. Left me more confused about my duties  than before. Demeaned my request for a simple support mechanism instead of addressing it directly. This event connects directly to the later A05 floor stop incident with Carlos : in both cases, the absence of clear, supportive, and effective leadership left associates without proper direction in critical moments. Additional points of concern: James continues to pressure me about KNET trainings, insisting I “rush through them,” despite these modules being poorly designed and counterproductive to true learning. He frequently assigns tasks without ensuring I have the training or clarity to complete them, then follows up with criticism rather than guidance. During the recent evacuation drill, his own actions suggested he was uncertain of proper procedure, which was noticeable to the team. This management style— unapproachable yet evasive , inviting questions but unable to provide answers—creates a cycle of frustration and confusion. It directly undermines operational efficiency and safety. Ironically, the KNET trainings themselves emphasize: “If you don’t know how to do something or don’t feel comfortable, stop and ask leadership for help.”  But when I do ask, I am met with lectures that attempt to make me feel incompetent rather than supported. Despite this, my performance metrics show I am effectively juggling a very large workload (up to 18 tasks per shift) at a level equal to or above peers. My concern is not about ability—it is about the lack of clear, constructive, and professional leadership  on my shift. I am raising this because, without improvement, this dynamic will continue to create safety risks, erode morale, and negatively impact performance. Thank you for ensuring this is properly logged and reviewed. Sincerely, Ethan Womack RME Tech 2 – Robotics/Mechatronics

Do not click links or open attachments unless you can confirm the sender and know the content is safe.   AWS Cloud Institute Hi Womack,, Congrats on registering for your AWS Cloud Institute courses - we are thrilled to be with you on your cloud journey! You are registered for the following AWS Cloud Institute courses for the upcoming quarter starting Oct 6, 2025: Introduction to Cloud Foundations Developer Fundamentals AWS Cloud Operations 1 Please select your session times You'll need to choose a time slot for your instructor-led sessions in each course. column1: P {margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;} Essentially Tori - I want to meet to see if there's a way for me to receive the same benefit my employment offers if I had enrolled into a university on the list, and apply it instead towards supplementing this Grant through AWS Cloud Institute that I just finished applying for. I believe I did it too late to be considered for this current enrollment - But perhaps we can find a way to do so - or perhaps you can help me navigate some form of accommodation, - as I've already paid the $600+ as of yesterday and I was really counting on the Career Choice reimbursement on Oct 8 th  - which is my 90 day mark.  Here's the pasted info from the grant I just signed up for so you have some context. Dear Ethan Womack, Thank you for submitting your application for the AWS Cloud Institute Learner Grant. Below, you’ll find a detailed guide on the next steps to ensure a smooth process: Next Steps for Your Learner Grant Application 1. Application Updates Deadline to Update Your Application : November 8, 2025, at 11:59 PM PT. If you need to revise your application, log in to your ISTS homepage and make necessary updates before the deadline. 2. Notification of Grant Results Decision Announcement Date : December 12, 2025. Notifications will be sent via email from donotreply@applyISTS.com or ContactUs@applyISTS.com . Add these email addresses to your "safe senders list" to avoid missing important updates. 3. Course Registration Registration Opens : December 12, 2025. Registration Deadline : January 4, 2026, at 11:59 PM PT. Do not register for courses before January 4, 2026. Spots in the program will be held for all grant applicants, regardless of grant outcome. 4. Prepare for Courses Winter 2026 Courses Start : January 5, 2026. Ensure that you are ready to begin classes by confirming your access to a computer and internet. Additional Important Information Notifications All updates regarding your grant application will be sent via email. While you may choose to opt out of notifications, we strongly discourage this. If you opt out, you must log in to your ISTS homepage regularly to check your application status. Grant Recipient Responsibilities If selected, you must register for courses by January 4, 2026. Failure to do so will result in forfeiture of the grant. Grant funds will be automatically applied to your monthly invoice for AWS Cloud Institute. Need Help? Visit our Self-Help Portal for guidance. Email ISTS Program Support at ContactUs@applyISTS.com (use the subject line: AWS Cloud Institute Learner Grant ). Today you were invoiced for AWS Cloud Institute. We attempted to charge your

To help ensure this payment processes, please take the following actions:

column2: Check that the payment method in your

column1: AWS Billing Console has sufficient funds and is unexpired.

column2: Some credit cards and debit cards require payment authorization at the

contacts you via text message, call, or email asking you to authorize the
payment, please reply to your card issuer immediately.

column2: Request a phone call from

column1: AWS Billing Support to manually retry your payment. To ensure your case is

Ethan Ross Womack RME Robotics / Mechatronics Technician – Operations Amazon TPA4 – North America Operations 📧 erwomack@amazon.com 📞 +1 (352) 252-0033 💬 Slack | Teams | @ ERWomack 🌐 inside.amazon.com From: noreply@awscloudinstitute.com <noreply@awscloudinstitute.com> Sent: Monday, October 6, 2025 1:00 PM To: Womack, Ethan <erwomack@amazon.com> Subject: [EXTERNAL] Action Required - AWS Cloud Institute Payment Not Processed   CAUTION : This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you can confirm the sender and know the content is safe.   AWS Cloud Institute Hi Womack,, Today you were invoiced for AWS Cloud Institute. We attempted to charge your payment method on file, but the payment has not processed successfully. We will automatically attempt this charge again, every 48 hours at 9am PT. To help ensure this payment processes, please take the following actions: Check that the payment method in your AWS Billing Console has sufficient funds and is unexpired. Some credit cards and debit cards require payment authorization at the time of the charge attempt to process the payment. If your card issuer contacts you via text message, call, or email asking you to authorize the payment, please reply to your card issuer immediately. Request a phone call from AWS Billing Support to manually retry your payment. To ensure your case is routed to an appropriate team member, select Service: Billing and Category: Payment Issue. More information is available in our FAQ . If you have any questions, please contact AWS Billing Support. Thanks, AWS Cloud Institute         Amazon Web Services, Inc. is a subsidiary of Amazon.com, Inc. Amazon.com is a registered trademark of Amazon.com, Inc. 20251102131509-message-1-65.eml,"Mon, 06 Oct 2025 18:25:22 -0500","""Womack, Ethan""",Ethan Womack <47loginslater@gmail.com>,,,Tech to Corporate,"Amazon Q said - about my application refinements
After reviewing Andre Barkhordarian's career progression and the CI
Execution team structure alongside your revised resume, there are compelling
parallels that strengthen your application. Andre's path from Service
Technician to Global CI Execution Lead demonstrates that Amazon values
technical expertise combined with leadership growth. Your resume effectively
positions you for a similar trajectory, particularly with your focus on
- Andre's background shows progression from technical roles (Service
Technician III) to leadership positions, similar to your desired path
- The CI Execution team has a significant focus on cross-functional
coordination, which your TechDoc-Agent project directly addresses
- Your resume effectively highlights transformation leadership, matching the
- The team structure (7 direct reports under Andre) suggests opportunities
- Consider adding metrics about resource optimization, as this appears to be
a key focus for the team
- Your knowledge management initiatives align with the team's global
- The resume successfully positions you as a bridge between technical
- The Professional Focus section effectively mirrors the team's current
- Your experience with HR process improvement demonstrates valuable
1. Could you add specific metrics about resource utilization improvements
from your TechDoc-Agent initiative to align with the team's focus on RME
2. Given Andre's career progression from technical roles, should we add more
emphasis on your technical-to-leadership transition story?
3. Would it be valuable to highlight any experience with global or
multi-site initiatives, given the team's distributed nature across 8
Consider adding a brief mention of any experience with Canadian operations
or cross-border collaboration, as Andre's background includes significant
experience in Canadian facilities, which could be relevant for global team

P {margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;} Amazon Q said - about my application refinements "**Summary:** After reviewing Andre Barkhordarian's career progression and the CI Execution team structure alongside your revised resume, there are compelling parallels that strengthen your application. Andre's path from Service Technician to Global CI Execution Lead demonstrates that Amazon values technical expertise combined with leadership growth. Your resume effectively positions you for a similar trajectory, particularly with your focus on systems integration and process improvement. **Key Points:** - Andre's background shows progression from technical roles (Service Technician III) to leadership positions, similar to your desired path - The CI Execution team has a significant focus on cross-functional coordination, which your TechDoc-Agent project directly addresses - Your resume effectively highlights transformation leadership, matching the team's current needs - The team structure (7 direct reports under Andre) suggests opportunities for immediate impact - Consider adding metrics about resource optimization, as this appears to be a key focus for the team - Your knowledge management initiatives align with the team's global coordination needs - The resume successfully positions you as a bridge between technical operations and strategic improvement - The Professional Focus section effectively mirrors the team's current direction under Andre's leadership - Your experience with HR process improvement demonstrates valuable stakeholder management skills **Questions:** 1. Could you add specific metrics about resource utilization improvements from your TechDoc-Agent initiative to align with the team's focus on RME resource optimization? 2. Given Andre's career progression from technical roles, should we add more emphasis on your technical-to-leadership transition story? 3. Would it be valuable to highlight any experience with global or multi-site initiatives, given the team's distributed nature across 8 locations? Suggested Enhancement: Consider adding a brief mention of any experience with Canadian operations or cross-border collaboration, as Andre's background includes significant experience in Canadian facilities, which could be relevant for global team coordination." P {margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;} Hi James, Thank you so much for your reply and for pointing me toward potential openings in the Virginia region. 20251102131505-message-1-20.eml,"Tue, 07 Oct 2025 11:19:49 -0500","""Womack, Ethan""","""Wright, Sara""","""Smith, Jena""",,The Sentinel Framework,"Sara,
I appreciate being looped in. My focus is making sure our techs are safe,
informed, and able to self-serve reliable documentation. A lot of the
friction youre hearing traces back to unclear policy ownership and
missing knowledge pathwaysthats why I built the Sentinel Framework to
propose a solution instead of a complaint.
I appreciate your willingness and interest to listen to our concerns, and
as you witnessed - Our pain points are the same, from the most experienced
among us, to those like me just approaching their 90 day mark.
I sent this document out previously in parts shortly after arriving at
Amazon, to several interested parties at different levels. I hope you find
it helpful in identifying and collaborating with your fellow heads of
department to implement real solutions and continue to improve the process
Amazon has more than enough resources for creative ideas to impact the
trajectory of its own evolution in a positive way that both alievates
needless strain and balance out the rollercoaster metrics you described.
If you find any of this useful and have further questions I'm more than
willing to meet again and work together to achieve such results. Thank you
There are specifics outlined in this document which you requested today,
however the bigger picture that such datapoints infer are of a higher
Symptoms in a system tell of the problem, not what to fix or replace. They
also show a trend of what will result if the root of the issues are not
You've got this. I believe in you!

Subject: Re: You have successfully enrolled in Professional Development
Hey Jena - I did meet with Tori today and she's going to see what she can do
to put in a good word at least and perhaps we'll be able to apply the Career
Choice benefit to AWS's Cloud Institute.
I didn't read carefully enough, but technically Career Choice doesn't
explicitly state it's available for AWS's Cloud Institute, but who knows why
or how - It should be, and either way in the grand scheme of things this
path is worth me investing in myself either way - so we shall see.
Hope all is well with you. Tori's moving into your old office and seems to
be moving right on up just like you.
Subject: RE: You have successfully enrolled in Professional Development
That is amazing Ethan!!! I am so happy for you!!
I know you were planned to meet with Tori today, so please let me know if
Subject: Fw: You have successfully enrolled in Professional Development
It took some creativity - but I finally was able to get the Cloud Institute
website to cooperate and now it's official!
Not sure how the Career Choice reimbursement thing works exactly but I'm
sure as you stated the other day Jena, that Tori is more than capable of
guiding me through it - I'm just excited and glad that I actually enrolled
Thank you both again for all of your help along the way.

preventive maintenance work orders to a single technician (ERWOMACK).

meetings, management issued performance reprimands rather than recognizing

Systemic mismatch between PMO policy and scheduler logic. Recommendation: Integrate freeze metadata into APM and align managerial KPIs with policy compliance. Cedric (Confidential Internal AI) Summary Managerial language constituted potential harassment and bias. Performance evaluation was procedurally flawed. Recommended escalation to HR to ensure due process and prevent retaliation. 6 | Key Findings Policy Violation:  Work orders scheduled during Blocked period contradict global freeze protocol. Managerial Misconduct:  Reprimand issued without fact-finding or policy context. Escalation Failure:  Ownership matrix steps (L5 → L7) ignored. Managerial Training:  Re-educate L5 + L6 leaders on Ownership and Escalation matrix and context-aware evaluation. Compliance Audit:  Request OTS/PMO review of TPA4 for adherence to freeze policy and escalation standards. Career Choice has eliminated the tuition reimbursement payment option.

reimbursement payment option is only be available for books and fees.
Also, as per policy, they cannot process payments for classes that started
prior to your Career Choice eligibility date.
If you have any further questions please let me know.
Tori Wilson | Sr. HR Business Partner

column1: P {margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;} Hi Ethan!  I have an update on the Career Choice payment concern regarding your enrollment date.  Career Choice has eliminated the tuition reimbursement payment option. Meaning all tuition requests are prepaid directly to the school. The reimbursement payment option is only be available for books and fees. Also, as per policy, they cannot process payments for classes that started prior to your Career Choice eligibility date. If you have any further questions please let me know. Sincerely,   Tori Wilson | Sr. HR Business Partner North American Fulfillment – TPA4 Work hard. Have fun. Make History   From:  Womack, Ethan <erwomack@amazon.com> Sent:  Monday, October 06, 2025 12:51 PM To:  Wilson, Tori <vctwils@amazon.com> Subject:  AWS Cloud Institute + Amazon Career Choice reimbursements Essentially Tori - I want to meet to see if there's a way for me to receive the same benefit my employment offers if I had enrolled into a university on the list, and apply it instead towards supplementing this Grant through AWS Cloud Institute that I just finished applying for. I believe I did it too late to be considered for this current enrollment - But perhaps we can find a way to do so - or perhaps you can help me navigate some form of accommodation, - as I've already paid the $600+ as of yesterday and I was really counting on the Career Choice reimbursement on Oct 8 th  - which is my 90 day mark.  Here's the pasted info from the grant I just signed up for so you have some context. Dear Ethan Womack, Thank you for submitting your application for the AWS Cloud Institute Learner Grant. Below, you’ll find a detailed guide on the next steps to ensure a smooth process: Next Steps for Your Learner Grant Application 1. Application Updates Deadline to Update Your Application : November 8, 2025, at 11:59 PM PT. If you need to revise your application, log in to your ISTS homepage and make necessary updates before the deadline. 2. Notification of Grant Results Decision Announcement Date : December 12, 2025. Notifications will be sent via email from donotreply@applyISTS.com or ContactUs@applyISTS.com . Add these email addresses to your "safe senders list" to avoid missing important updates. 3. Course Registration Registration Opens : December 12, 2025. Registration Deadline : January 4, 2026, at 11:59 PM PT. Do not register for courses before January 4, 2026. Spots in the program will be held for all grant applicants, regardless of grant outcome. 4. Prepare for Courses Winter 2026 Courses Start : January 5, 2026. Ensure that you are ready to begin classes by confirming your access to a computer and internet. Additional Important Information Notifications All updates regarding your grant application will be sent via email. While you may choose to opt out of notifications, we strongly discourage this. If you opt out, you must log in to your ISTS homepage regularly to check your application status. Grant Recipient Responsibilities If selected, you must register for courses by January 4, 2026. Failure to do so will result in forfeiture of the grant. Grant funds will be automatically applied to your monthly invoice for AWS Cloud Institute. Need Help? Visit our Self-Help Portal for guidance. Email ISTS Program Support at ContactUs@applyISTS.com (use the subject line: AWS Cloud Institute Learner Grant ). 20251102131515-message-1-135.eml,"Tue, 07 Oct 2025 20:33:13 -0500","""Gedeon, Edward""","""Womack, Ethan""",,,"Re: Facility Operations Center Engineer, ADC Facility Operations Center, (L4) (ID:3041697)","Hey Ethan,
Thanks for your interest in the ADC FOC! I’m happy to chat with you about
the role/team, but unfortunately without an active clearance we wouldn’t be
able to proceed to an application at this time. There is a commercial FOC
team that is in IAD31 (Herndon, VA) that doesn’t need the clearance, but
obviously not the area you’re interested in. I’m not sure if there are
uncleared infra roles in the DEN area.
Subject: Facility Operations Center Engineer, ADC Facility Operations
My name is Ethan Womack, and I am currently an Amazon RME Service Technician
II (L3). I am reaching out regarding the Facility Operations Center Engineer
I bring 15 years of HVAC experience, including a year of mission-critical
work with Blackmon Service maintaining Liebert systems, and I am approaching
90 days with Amazon RME where I support robotics and mechatronics in
safety-critical environments. These experiences have given me strong
grounding in reliability, redundancy, and troubleshooting in facilities that
I recognize that this particular role requires an active TS/SCI with
polygraph clearance, which I do not currently hold. That said, I wanted to
express my interest, as I already meet the core technical qualifications and
am willing and able to pursue clearance in the future. I would also be
grateful to learn if there are related AWS Infrastructure opportunities in
the Aurora/Denver area that would align with my skills and provide a strong
entry point into AWS Infra while I continue pursuing certifications through
AWS Cloud Institute, Cybersecurity tracks, and Machine Learning University
My long-term goal is to build a career within AWS Infrastructure and AI/ML
DevOps, with this kind of operations role as a foundation. I would welcome
the opportunity to schedule a brief informational conversation with you (or
someone from your team) to learn more about the FOC Engineer role and
discuss how my background might align with current or future opportunities
Thank you very much for your time and consideration.

column1: P {margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;} Of course they did - lol - Oh well thanks for finding that out for me Ethan Ross Womack RME Robotics / Mechatronics Technician – Operations Amazon TPA4 – North America Operations 📧 erwomack@amazon.com 📞 +1 (352) 252-0033 💬 Slack | Teams | @ ERWomack 🌐 inside.amazon.com From: Wilson, Tori <vctwils@amazon.com> Sent: Tuesday, October 7, 2025 7:18 PM To: Womack, Ethan <erwomack@amazon.com> Subject: Re: AWS Cloud Institute + Amazon Career Choice reimbursements   Hi Ethan!  I have an update on the Career Choice payment concern regarding your enrollment date.  Career Choice has eliminated the tuition reimbursement payment option. Meaning all tuition requests are prepaid directly to the school. The reimbursement payment option is only be available for books and fees. Also, as per policy, they cannot process payments for classes that started prior to your Career Choice eligibility date. If you have any further questions please let me know. Sincerely,   Tori Wilson | Sr. HR Business Partner North American Fulfillment – TPA4 Work hard. Have fun. Make History   From:  Womack, Ethan <erwomack@amazon.com> Sent:  Monday, October 06, 2025 12:51 PM To:  Wilson, Tori <vctwils@amazon.com> Subject:  AWS Cloud Institute + Amazon Career Choice reimbursements Essentially Tori - I want to meet to see if there's a way for me to receive the same benefit my employment offers if I had enrolled into a university on the list, and apply it instead towards supplementing this Grant through AWS Cloud Institute that I just finished applying for. I believe I did it too late to be considered for this current enrollment - But perhaps we can find a way to do so - or perhaps you can help me navigate some form of accommodation, - as I've already paid the $600+ as of yesterday and I was really counting on the Career Choice reimbursement on Oct 8 th  - which is my 90 day mark.  Here's the pasted info from the grant I just signed up for so you have some context. Despite this, the APM  system auto-generated and assigned 14 Priority 5 preventive maintenance work orders  to a single technician (ERWOMACK). When these could not be executed due to freeze compliance and mandatory meetings, management issued performance reprimands rather than recognizing the systemic contradiction. Independent analyses from both Amazon Q  and Cedric (Internal Compliance AI)  have verified the event chain as a policy-system synchronization failure , not technician negligence. 2 | Policy Context Global PMO Code Freeze Policy:  Defines Advisory, Restricted, and Blocked days requiring multi-level approvals (L7 → L8 → Customer L8). Scope:  Applies to all RME design, software, and maintenance changes during peak. Intent:  Preserve operational stability during Prime Day. Conflict:  APM scheduler does not ingest PMO freeze calendar metadata. 3 | Event Timeline (10 / 7 / 2025) Time Event Impact 04 : 30 – 08 : 00 No PMs visible No actionable tasks 08 : 15 14 PMs auto-assigned Violation of Code Freeze logic 08 : 23 Summoned by @Nate Hendricks for training Removed from floor 09 : 00 – 13 : 30 Meetings with Sara (RM) and Jon 4 + hours non-productive 14 : 50 – 15 : 10 Reprimand from Ryan Truax Misinterpretation of metrics Total hours lost to mandatory meetings/training:  ≈ 6 hrs Available time for execution:  < 2 hrs Number of PMs:  14 (non-critical) 4 | Ownership and Escalation Matrix Cross-Check According to Ownership and Escalation v05-18-2021.xlsx : L5/L6 Area Managers  must verify policy alignment before disciplinary coaching. L7 Regional Manager  must escalate any policy versus system conflict to OTS Central. L8 OTS Leaders  are final arbiters for Blocked Days. No escalation occurred. The reprimand was issued in violation of this matrix. 5 | Independent Analyses Amazon Q Summary APM auto-scheduled 14 open PMs within freeze window. Systemic mismatch between PMO policy and scheduler logic. Recommendation: Integrate freeze metadata into APM and align managerial KPIs with policy compliance. Cedric (Confidential Internal AI) Summary Managerial language constituted potential harassment and bias. Performance evaluation was procedurally flawed. Recommended escalation to HR to ensure due process and prevent retaliation. 6 | Key Findings Policy Violation:  Work orders scheduled during Blocked period contradict global freeze protocol. Managerial Misconduct:  Reprimand issued without fact-finding or policy context. Escalation Failure:  Ownership matrix steps (L5 → L7) ignored. System Defect:  APM lacks policy metadata synchronization. Cultural Deficiency:  Metrics prioritized over compliance and technician well-being. 7 | Recommendations for HR and Leadership Immediate HR Review:  Investigate managerial conduct for potential harassment and procedural violations. Policy Integration:  Mandate APM ↔ PMO metadata link to auto-suspend non-critical PMs during freeze. Managerial Training:  Re-educate L5 + L6 leaders on Ownership and Escalation matrix and context-aware evaluation. Compliance Audit:  Request OTS/PMO review of TPA4 for adherence to freeze policy and escalation standards. Hey Ethan, thank you for sharing these concerns with the PXT team. Let me connect with the PXT Team and circle back,  Jessi Get Outlook for iOS From: Womack, Ethan <erwomack@amazon.com> Sent: Tuesday, October 7, 2025 4:39:19 PM To: Bonanno, Jessi <jesbon@amazon.com>; Smith, Jena <jenasmit@amazon.com>; Wilson, Tori <vctwils@amazon.com> Cc: Wright, Sara <saracw@amazon.com> Subject: Formal Escalation: Code Freeze Policy Violation / Managerial Misconduct / RME-PMO Synchronization Failure   Formal Escalation Report — TPA4 Prime Day 2025 Case Study Author:  Ethan Womack (ERWOMACK) Department:  RME – TA4D Date:  October 7 2025 1 | Executive Summary Between October 5 – 11 2025, Amazon RME entered a Code Freeze  period meant to prevent all non-critical operational changes. Despite this, the APM  system auto-generated and assigned 14 Priority 5 preventive maintenance work orders  to a single technician (ERWOMACK). When these could not be executed due to freeze compliance and mandatory meetings, management issued performance reprimands rather than recognizing the systemic contradiction. Independent analyses from both Amazon Q  and Cedric (Internal Compliance AI)  have verified the event chain as a policy-system synchronization failure , not technician negligence. 2 | Policy Context Global PMO Code Freeze Policy:  Defines Advisory, Restricted, and Blocked days requiring multi-level approvals (L7 → L8 → Customer L8). Scope:  Applies to all RME design, software, and maintenance changes during peak. Intent:  Preserve operational stability during Prime Day. Conflict:  APM scheduler does not ingest PMO freeze calendar metadata. 3 | Event Timeline (10 / 7 / 2025) Time Event Impact 04 : 30 – 08 : 00 No PMs visible No actionable tasks 08 : 15 14 PMs auto-assigned Violation of Code Freeze logic 08 : 23 Summoned by @Nate Hendricks for training Removed from floor 09 : 00 – 13 : 30 Meetings with Sara (RM) and Jon 4 + hours non-productive 14 : 50 – 15 : 10 Reprimand from Ryan Truax Misinterpretation of metrics Total hours lost to mandatory meetings/training:  ≈ 6 hrs Available time for execution:  < 2 hrs Number of PMs:  14 (non-critical) 4 | Ownership and Escalation Matrix Cross-Check According to Ownership and Escalation v05-18-2021.xlsx : L5/L6 Area Managers  must verify policy alignment before disciplinary coaching. L7 Regional Manager  must escalate any policy versus system conflict to OTS Central. L8 OTS Leaders  are final arbiters for Blocked Days. No escalation occurred. The reprimand was issued in violation of this matrix. 5 | Independent Analyses Amazon Q Summary APM auto-scheduled 14 open PMs within freeze window. Systemic mismatch between PMO policy and scheduler logic. Recommendation: Integrate freeze metadata into APM and align managerial KPIs with policy compliance. Cedric (Confidential Internal AI) Summary Managerial language constituted potential harassment and bias. Performance evaluation was procedurally flawed. Recommended escalation to HR to ensure due process and prevent retaliation. 6 | Key Findings Policy Violation:  Work orders scheduled during Blocked period contradict global freeze protocol. Managerial Misconduct:  Reprimand issued without fact-finding or policy context. Escalation Failure:  Ownership matrix steps (L5 → L7) ignored. System Defect:  APM lacks policy metadata synchronization. Cultural Deficiency:  Metrics prioritized over compliance and technician well-being. 7 | Recommendations for HR and Leadership Immediate HR Review:  Investigate managerial conduct for potential harassment and procedural violations. Policy Integration:  Mandate APM ↔ PMO metadata link to auto-suspend non-critical PMs during freeze. Managerial Training:  Re-educate L5 + L6 leaders on Ownership and Escalation matrix and context-aware evaluation. Compliance Audit:  Request OTS/PMO review of TPA4 for adherence to freeze policy and escalation standards. Protection from Retaliation:  Confirm ERWOMACK is covered under Amazon’s Zero Retaliation Policy pending investigation. 8 | Attachments NA USA & CA – Prime Big Deal Days RME Code Freeze Announcement.eml Ownership and Escalation v05-18-2021.xlsx Slack conversation with Ryan Truax (10-7-2025) Q and Cedric AI analysis transcripts APM Work Order Report (ARSTOW PMs Oct 9–14 2025) Prepared and submitted in good faith for review under Amazon’s Standards of Conduct and Zero Retaliation Policy. — Ethan Womack (ERWOMACK) Here's the pasted slack exchange at the end of my day between Ryan (AMM) and Jon (MM) - I spoke today with Sara Wright about the effects of "ineffective communication" between management - operations - and especially new techs"  @Bonanno, Jessi  I'm going to add you to the actually slack thread because ...  I don't want anything to disappear.  " Jon Templeton, Ryan Truax 3 Messages Untitled CanvasListFolder This is the very beginning of your direct message history with @templetj  and @ryantrua You’ll be notified for every new message  in this conversation. Change this setting Ryan Truax  2:50 PM All PMs were assigned by 0815 we can verify that via Audit trail. You have Zero time booked in APM for the day. The meeting and training accounts for 2.5 hours of your day breaks another hour. What did you do with the other 7 hours? Still showing all of them open? This is two days in a row and you’ve only been on the team two days. I could see if you couldn’t complete 1 or 2 but you haven’t completed any and you go home in 10 minutes. Ethan Womack Just to let you know, with the impromptu hour and a half long meeting, the other one at 2 as well as the learn portal block - and since the drive pms were not listed until after I went to the learn training meet at 8 30 - I wont be able to complete all of these today. All I can do is get done with what I can and communicate it to you now, as U just saw that apm was updated. Direct Message  | Today at 12:33 PM  | View conversation Ethan Womack  2:54 PM As I said, if tbey werent assigned until 815 then i was never given time to see them until after the meeting with Sara Ethan Womack  3:03 PM Heres the message Nate Hendricks @erwomack   @mykconne  please come to the AMMs office for training Thread in ta4a-daily-training-hour-  | Today at 8:23 AM  | View message Ryan Truax  3:10 PM From 04:30 to 08:00, there was no observed initiative to begin or review PM assignments for your area. Between approximately 08:15 and 11:00, there was still no engagement with APM or verification of assigned tasks. From 11:00 onward, there remains no clear record of productive work completed or progress made toward daily goals. You are aware that PMs are assigned daily, and you were on the same floor yesterday with full visibility to the current schedule. This lack of action and follow-through demonstrates poor initiative and accountability. At this level, you are expected to manage your time effectively and take ownership of your assigned area without needing constant direction or oversight. These repeated behaviors are not acceptable, especially when other technicians in identical circumstances successfully completed their work. Immediate improvement is expected in task ownership, time management, and proactive engagement with daily PM assignments. " Ethan Ross Womack RME Robotics / Mechatronics Technician – Operations Amazon TPA4 – North America Operations 📧 erwomack@amazon.com 📞 +1 (352) 252-0033 💬 Slack | Teams | @ ERWomack 🌐 inside.amazon.com

Hey Ethan, 🎉Congratulations on completing ML for Leaders Generative AI! By completing this course you're now able to: Identify and use generative AI vocabulary, such as embeddings, foundation models, hallucinations, and Amazon Bedrock. Categorize the techniques to ground a model, such as prompt engineering, fine-tuning, retrieval augmented generation, and tools. Prepare to measure performance, lead, and audit an AI system. Use Amazon tools, such as Cedric, Matome, PartyRock, Amazon Q Internal and Amazon Q Business, to increase productivity and prototype solutions. Apply the responsible AI process at Amazon throughout your generative AI use cases. Discover the latest generative AI developments, such as agents and multimodal systems. 🥁Drum roll please… we’re excited to announce you’re an MLU alum! We can’t wait to learn how you’ll implement your ML knowledge in your role! Ethan, complete the End of Course survey in My MLU to receive your MLU Graduate Phone Tool icon! 🎊✨🎉 Continue your MLU journey by registering for your next class! 20251102131512-message-1-97.eml,"Mon, 13 Oct 2025 17:37:06 -0500","""Gedeon, Edward""","""Womack, Ethan""",,,"Re: Facility Operations Center Engineer, ADC Facility Operations Center, (L4) (ID:3041697)","I’m in Australia for all-day meetings until the 20th so the timing will be
tough before then. Feel free to grab an opening on my calendar after the
Subject: Re: Facility Operations Center Engineer, ADC Facility Operations
When would you be able to hop on a quick meeting?
I appreciate you taking the time to speak with me.
Here are some times that work for me:
Subject: Re: Facility Operations Center Engineer, ADC Facility Operations
Thanks for your interest in the ADC FOC! I’m happy to chat with you about
the role/team, but unfortunately without an active clearance we wouldn’t be
able to proceed to an application at this time. There is a commercial FOC
team that is in IAD31 (Herndon, VA) that doesn’t need the clearance, but
obviously not the area you’re interested in. I’m not sure if there are
uncleared infra roles in the DEN area.
Subject: Facility Operations Center Engineer, ADC Facility Operations
My name is Ethan Womack, and I am currently an Amazon RME Service Technician
II (L3). I am reaching out regarding the Facility Operations Center Engineer
I bring 15 years of HVAC experience, including a year of mission-critical
work with Blackmon Service maintaining Liebert systems, and I am approaching
90 days with Amazon RME where I support robotics and mechatronics in
safety-critical environments. These experiences have given me strong
grounding in reliability, redundancy, and troubleshooting in facilities that
I recognize that this particular role requires an active TS/SCI with
polygraph clearance, which I do not currently hold. That said, I wanted to
express my interest, as I already meet the core technical qualifications and
am willing and able to pursue clearance in the future. I would also be
grateful to learn if there are related AWS Infrastructure opportunities in
the Aurora/Denver area that would align with my skills and provide a strong
entry point into AWS Infra while I continue pursuing certifications through
AWS Cloud Institute, Cybersecurity tracks, and Machine Learning University
My long-term goal is to build a career within AWS Infrastructure and AI/ML
DevOps, with this kind of operations role as a foundation. I would welcome
the opportunity to schedule a brief informational conversation with you (or
someone from your team) to learn more about the FOC Engineer role and
discuss how my background might align with current or future opportunities
Thank you very much for your time and consideration.

Let me connect with the PXT Team and circle back,  Jessi Get Outlook for iOS From: Womack, Ethan <erwomack@amazon.com> Sent: Tuesday, October 7, 2025 4:39:19 PM To: Bonanno, Jessi <jesbon@amazon.com>; Smith, Jena <jenasmit@amazon.com>; Wilson, Tori <vctwils@amazon.com> Cc: Wright, Sara <saracw@amazon.com> Subject: Formal Escalation: Code Freeze Policy Violation / Managerial Misconduct / RME-PMO Synchronization Failure   Formal Escalation Report — TPA4 Prime Day 2025 Case Study Author:  Ethan Womack (ERWOMACK) Department:  RME – TA4D Date:  October 7 2025 1 | Executive Summary Between October 5 – 11 2025, Amazon RME entered a Code Freeze  period meant to prevent all non-critical operational changes. Despite this, the APM  system auto-generated and assigned 14 Priority 5 preventive maintenance work orders  to a single technician (ERWOMACK). When these could not be executed due to freeze compliance and mandatory meetings, management issued performance reprimands rather than recognizing the systemic contradiction. Independent analyses from both Amazon Q  and Cedric (Internal Compliance AI)  have verified the event chain as a policy-system synchronization failure , not technician negligence. 2 | Policy Context Global PMO Code Freeze Policy:  Defines Advisory, Restricted, and Blocked days requiring multi-level approvals (L7 → L8 → Customer L8). Scope:  Applies to all RME design, software, and maintenance changes during peak. Intent:  Preserve operational stability during Prime Day. Conflict:  APM scheduler does not ingest PMO freeze calendar metadata. 3 | Event Timeline (10 / 7 / 2025) Time Event Impact 04 : 30 – 08 : 00 No PMs visible No actionable tasks 08 : 15 14 PMs auto-assigned Violation of Code Freeze logic 08 : 23 Summoned by @Nate Hendricks for training Removed from floor 09 : 00 – 13 : 30 Meetings with Sara (RM) and Jon 4 + hours non-productive 14 : 50 – 15 : 10 Reprimand from Ryan Truax Misinterpretation of metrics Total hours lost to mandatory meetings/training:  ≈ 6 hrs Available time for execution:  < 2 hrs Number of PMs:  14 (non-critical) 4 | Ownership and Escalation Matrix Cross-Check According to Ownership and Escalation v05-18-2021.xlsx : L5/L6 Area Managers  must verify policy alignment before disciplinary coaching. L7 Regional Manager  must escalate any policy versus system conflict to OTS Central. L8 OTS Leaders  are final arbiters for Blocked Days. No escalation occurred. The reprimand was issued in violation of this matrix. 5 | Independent Analyses Amazon Q Summary APM auto-scheduled 14 open PMs within freeze window. Systemic mismatch between PMO policy and scheduler logic. Recommendation: Integrate freeze metadata into APM and align managerial KPIs with policy compliance. Cedric (Confidential Internal AI) Summary Managerial language constituted potential harassment and bias. Performance evaluation was procedurally flawed. Recommended escalation to HR to ensure due process and prevent retaliation. 6 | Key Findings Policy Violation:  Work orders scheduled during Blocked period contradict global freeze protocol. Managerial Misconduct:  Reprimand issued without fact-finding or policy context. Escalation Failure:  Ownership matrix steps (L5 → L7) ignored. System Defect:  APM lacks policy metadata synchronization. Cultural Deficiency:  Metrics prioritized over compliance and technician well-being. 7 | Recommendations for HR and Leadership Immediate HR Review:  Investigate managerial conduct for potential harassment and procedural violations. Policy Integration:  Mandate APM ↔ PMO metadata link to auto-suspend non-critical PMs during freeze.
